jd: From: ayush, Scalable Systems ayush.yadav@scalable-systems.com Reply to: ayush.yadav@scalable-systems.com Product Analyst - MortgageLocation: McLean, VAKey Responsibilities:Mortgage Domain Expertise: Demonstrate a deep understanding of mortgage industry practices, regulations, and systems, particularly with experience in Freddie Mac or Fannie Mae.Business-Technical Liaison: Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, effectively communicating requirements and translating them into actionable specifications.SDLC Expertise: Possess a solid grasp of the software development lifecycle (SDLC), including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, and deployment.Requirements Analysis: Conduct thorough requirements analysis, including process/data flow design, technical spec design (Webservices/API), and business analysis.Technical Specification Design: Create detailed technical specifications, ensuring alignment with business objectives and technical feasibility.Project Management: Define project objectives, conduct feasibility analysis, and support development, systems integration testing, and user acceptance testing.Test Planning: Develop comprehensive UAT strategies, plans, and test cases/scripts to ensure product quality.Testing Expertise: Demonstrate knowledge of both manual and automation testing methodologies.Communication and Analytical Skills: Possess excellent communication and analytical skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and solve complex problems.User Story Writing: Write clear and concise user stories based on business-driven functionality and technical capabilities.Product Decision Support: Provide valuable insights and recommendations to both the Product Owner and IT team to inform product-related decisions.Customer-Centric Mindset: Foster a customer-centric approach within the Modern Delivery team, always keeping Freddie Mac's mission in mind.Team Collaboration: Actively participate in team development processes, contributing your expertise to define technical requirements and project/process specifications.Required Skills and Qualifications:Strong mortgage domain experience, preferably with Freddie Mac or Fannie MaeProven ability to interface effectively between business and technical teamsIn-depth understanding of the
